question: Question_A_20
statement:
Let \emph{A}, \emph{B}, \emph{C} and \emph{D} be four size $3\times 3$
invertible matrices. Circle all the options below that are equal to the
matrix $\displaystyle (A(BC)^{-1}D)^{T}$ independent of what
\emph{A},\emph{B},\emph{C} and \emph{D} are. No explanation required.

(a) $\displaystyle A^{T}B^{-T}C^{-T}D^{T}$

(b) $\displaystyle A^{T}(B^{-1})^{T}(C^{-1})^{T}D^{T}$

(c) $\displaystyle A^{T}(C^{-1})^{T}(B^{-1})^{T}D^{T}$

(d) $\displaystyle D^{T}(B^{-1})^{T}(C^{-1})^{T}A^{T}$

(e) $\displaystyle D^{T}(C^{-1})^{T}(B^{-1})^{T}A^{T}$
sols:
Only (d) is correct.

Recall $\displaystyle (AB)^T = B^TA^T$ and
$\displaystyle (AB)^{-1} = B^{-1}A^{-1}$ for invertible matrices. Then

\begin{align*}\displaystyle(A(BC)^{-1}D)^T = (AC^{-1}B^{-1}D)^T = D^{T}(B^{-1})^{T}(C^{-1})^{T}A^{T}\end{align*}
hints:
Recall $\displaystyle (AB)^T = B^TA^T$ and
$\displaystyle (AB)^{-1} = B^{-1}A^{-1}$ for invertible matrices.
